page.title: 20Travelling Services: FINTRY
page.content:
{The statistical survey for the {Domesday Project doesn't fit places {like this.}According to it we have no bank, library or surgery. Well, these might not be permanent fixtures, but we have them; they come to us on four wheels; even the Police come in cars.
The Bank comes once, the Surgery twice per week. They are held in the hall. The Library Van visits weekly and provides the same service as an urban branch library.
Fish, milk, meat, coal, oil, bottled and bulk gas are all delivered. These just costs more. It's extra tough on those who lack the ability to take advantage of town prices.
Public transport comprises the School, Post and once monthly Service Buses.
